body.p:
At first, the content of a document opened in the Grid mode is collapsed. Only the root element and its attributes are displayed. The grid disposition of the node names and values is similar to a web form or a dialog. The same set of key shortcuts used to select dialog components is also available in the Grid mode: Shortcuts in the Grid Mode
Key Action
Moves the caret to the next editable value in a table row.
Moves the caret to the previous editable value in a table row.
Begins editing and lets you insert a new value. Also commits the changes after you finish editing.
Navigates toward the beginning of the document.
Navigates toward the end of the document.
Used with the navigation keys, creates a selection area. To extend this area with other nodes from a different part of the document, use the caret and the Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) key.
The following key combinations can be used to scroll the grid:

ul.li: scrolls the grid to the left;
scrolls the grid to the right.

body.p: An arrow sign displayed at the left of the node name indicates that this node has child nodes. To display the children, click this sign. The expand/collapse actions can be invoked either with the and keys, or from the Expand/Collapse submenu of the contextual menu or from Document Grid Expand/Collapse .
